content.step1: Preheat oven to 350Â°F. Prepare two 8-inch round cake pans with butter and flour. Whisk together 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1 teaspoon salt.
content.step2: In a separate bowl, whisk 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder with 1 cup whole milk, 2 large eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Ensure the mixture is smooth.
content.step3: Combine dry and wet ingredients, whisking until well mixed. Add 1/2 cup vegetable oil and whisk until fully incorporated.
content.step4: Divide the batter evenly between prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
content.step5: Allow cakes to cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Prepare a chocolate frosting by whisking together 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, and 2 ounces melted chocolate.
content.step6: Assemble the cake by spreading frosting on one layer, then topping with the second layer. Frost the outside of the cake with remaining frosting and decorate as desired.
